titlegroupcell.title: Cleaning and protecting the vehicle exterior

paratablecell.paratabletxt: Perform cleaning in a manner appropriate to each component and its material.

list1_item.itemtxt: Working from top to bottom, liberally apply water to the vehicle body, wheel wells and underside of the vehicle to remove any dirt and dust.
Wash the vehicle body using a sponge or soft cloth, such as a chamois.
For hard-to-remove marks, use car wash soap and rinse thoroughly with water.
Wipe away any water.
Wax the vehicle when the waterproof coating deteriorates.
list1_item.itemtxt_sub: If water does not bead on a clean surface, apply wax when the vehicle body is cool.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Fold the mirrors before washing the vehicle. Start washing from the front of the vehicle. Make sure to extend the mirrors before driving.
Brushes used in automatic car washes may scratch the vehicle surface and harm your vehicle’s paint.

note_para.title: High pressure car washes
note_para.p: As water may enter the cabin, do not bring the nozzle tip near the gaps around the doors or perimeter of the windows, or spray these areas continuously.

note_para.title: When using a car wash (vehicles with a smart entry & start system)
note_para.p: If the door handle becomes wet while the electronic key is within the effective range, the door may lock and unlock repeatedly. In that case, follow the following correction procedures to wash the vehicle:

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Place the key in a position 2 m (6 ft.) or more separate from the vehicle while the vehicle is being washed. (Take care to ensure that the key is not stolen.)
Set the electronic key to battery-saving mode to disable the smart entry & start system. (→)
Remove any dirt immediately by using a neutral detergent.
Wash detergent off with water immediately after use.
To protect the paint from damage, make sure to observe the following precautions.

att_list2_item.itemtxt: Do not use acidic, alkaline or abrasive detergent
Do not use hard brushes
Do not use detergent on the wheels when they are hot, such as after driving or parking in hot weather

note_para.title: Bumpers
note_para.p: Do not scrub with abrasive cleaners.

note_para.title: Plated portions
note_para.p: If dirt cannot be removed, clean the parts as follows:

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Use a soft cloth dampened with an approximately 5% solution of neutral detergent and water to clean the dirt off.
Wipe the surface with a dry, soft cloth to remove any remaining moisture.
To remove oily deposits, use alcohol wet wipes or a similar product.

attention_para.title: When washing the vehicle
attention_para.p: Do not apply water to the inside of the engine compartment. Doing so may cause the electrical components, etc. to catch fire.

attention_para.title: When cleaning the windshield (vehicles with rain-sensing windshield wipers)
attention_para.p: Set the wiper switch to off. If the wiper switch is in “AUTO”, the wipers may operate unexpectedly in the following situations, and may result in hands being caught or other serious injuries and cause damage to the wiper blades.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: When the upper part of the windshield where the raindrop sensor is located is touched by hand
When a wet rag or similar is held close to the raindrop sensor
If something bumps against the windshield
If you directly touch the raindrop sensor body or if something bumps into the raindrop sensor

attention_para.title: Precautions regarding the exhaust pipe
attention_para.p: Exhaust gasses cause the exhaust pipe to become quite hot.When washing the vehicle, be careful not to touch the pipe until it has cooled sufficiently, as touching a hot exhaust pipe can cause burns.

attention_para.title: Precaution regarding the rear bumper with Blind Spot Monitor (if equipped)
attention_para.p: If the paint of the rear bumper is chipped or scratched, the system may malfunction. If this occurs, consult your Toyota dealer.

attention_para.title: To prevent paint deterioration and corrosion on the body and components (aluminum wheels, etc.)

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Wash the vehicle immediately in the following cases:

att_list2_item.itemtxt: After driving near the sea coast
After driving on salted roads
If coal tar or tree sap is present on the paint surface
If dead insects, insect droppings or bird droppings are present on the paint surface
After driving in an area contaminated with soot, oily smoke, mine dust, iron powder or chemical substances
If the vehicle becomes heavily soiled with dust or mud
If liquids such as benzene and gasoline are spilled on the paint surface

att_list1_item.itemtxt: If the paint is chipped or scratched, have it repaired immediately.
To prevent the wheels from corroding, remove any dirt and store in a place with low humidity when storing the wheels.
Wash carefully. Do not use organic substances or scrub with a hard brush.This may damage the surfaces of the lights.
Do not apply wax to the surfaces of the lights.Wax may cause damage to the lenses.

attention_para.title: To prevent damage to the windshield wiper arms
attention_para.p: When lifting the wiper arms away from the windshield, pull the driver side wiper arm upward first, and repeat for the passenger side. When returning the wipers to their original position, do so from the passenger side first.

attention_para.title: When using an automatic car wash (vehicles with rain-sensing windshield wipers)
attention_para.p: Set the wiper switch to the off position. If the wiper switch is in “AUTO”, the wipers may operate and the wiper blades may be damaged.

attention_para.title: When using a high pressure car wash

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Vehicles with rear view monitor system: When washing the vehicle, do not spray the camera or its surrounding area directly with a high pressure washer. Shock applied from high pressure water may cause the device to not operate normally.
Do not bring the nozzle tip close to boots (rubber or resin manufactured cover), connectors or the following parts. The parts may be damaged if they come into contact with high-pressure water.

att_list2_item.itemtxt: Traction related parts
Steering parts
Suspension parts
Brake parts

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Keep the cleaning nozzle at least 30 cm (11.9 in.) away from the vehicles body. Otherwise resin section, such as moldings and bumpers, may be deformed and damaged. Also, do not continuously hold the nozzle in the same place.

Do not spray the lower part of the windshield continuously. If water enters the air conditioning system intake located near the lower part of the windshield, the air conditioning system may not operate correctly.

titlegroupcell.title: Cleaning and protecting the vehicle interior

paratablecell.paratabletxt: Perform cleaning in a manner appropriate to each component and its material.

list1_item.itemtxt: Remove dirt and dust using a vacuum cleaner. Wipe dirty surfaces with a cloth dampened with lukewarm water.

If dirt cannot be removed, wipe it off with a soft cloth dampened with neutral detergent diluted to approximately 1%.Wring out any excess water from the cloth and thoroughly wipe off remaining traces of detergent and water.

note_para.title: Shampooing the carpets
note_para.p: There are several commercial foaming-type cleaners available. Use a sponge or brush to apply the foam. Rub in overlapping circles. Do not use water. Wipe dirty surfaces and let them dry. Excellent results are obtained by keeping the carpet as dry as possible.

note_para.title: Handling the seat belts
note_para.p: Clean with mild soap and lukewarm water using a cloth or sponge. Also check the belts periodically for excessive wear, fraying or cuts.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Do not splash or spill liquid in the vehicle.Doing so may cause electrical components, etc. to malfunction or catch fire.
Do not get any of the SRS components or wiring in the vehicle interior wet.(→)An electrical malfunction may cause the airbags to deploy or not function properly, resulting in death or serious injury.

Vehicles with wireless charger:Do not let the wireless charger (→) get wet. Failure to do so may cause the charger to become hot and cause burns or could cause electric shock resulting in death or serious injury.

attention_para.title: Cleaning the interior (especially instrument panel)
attention_para.p: Do not use polish wax or polish cleaner. The instrument panel may reflect off the windshield, obstructing the driver’s view and leading to an accident, resulting in death or serious injury.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Do not use the following types of detergent, as they may discolor the vehicle interior or cause streaks or damage to painted surfaces:

att_list2_item.itemtxt: Areas other than the seats and steering wheel: Organic substances such as benzene or gasoline, alkaline or acidic solutions, dye, and bleach
Seats: Alkaline or acidic solutions, such as thinner, benzene, and alcohol
Steering wheel: Organic substances, such as thinner, and cleaner that contains alcohol

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Do not use polish wax or polish cleaner. The instrument panel’s or other interior part’s painted surface may be damaged.

attention_para.title: Preventing damage to leather surfaces
attention_para.p: Observe the following precautions to avoid damage to and deterioration of leather surfaces:

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Remove any dust or dirt from leather surfaces immediately.
Do not expose the vehicle to direct sunlight for extended periods of time. Park the vehicle in the shade, especially during summer.
Do not place items made of vinyl, plastic, or containing wax on the upholstery, as they may stick to the leather surface if the vehicle interior heats up significantly.

attention_para.title: Water on the floor
attention_para.p: Do not wash the vehicle floor with water.Vehicle systems such as the audio system may be damaged if water comes into contact with electrical components such as the audio system above or under the floor of the vehicle. Water may also cause the body to rust.

attention_para.title: When cleaning the inside of the windshield (vehicles with Toyota Safety Sense)
attention_para.p: Do not allow glass cleaner to contact the lens. Also, do not touch the lens. (→)

attention_para.title: Cleaning the inside of the rear window

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Do not use glass cleaner to clean the rear window, as this may cause damage to the rear window defogger heater wires or antenna. Use a cloth dampened with lukewarm water to gently wipe the window clean. Wipe the window in strokes running parallel to the heater wires or antenna.
Be careful not to scratch or damage the heater wires or antenna.

titlegroupcell.title: Cleaning the areas with satin-finish metal accents

list1_item.itemtxt: Remove dirt using a water-dampened soft cloth or synthetic chamois.
Wipe the surface with a dry, soft cloth to remove any remaining moisture.

note_para.title: Cleaning the areas with satin-finish metal accents
note_para.p: The metal areas use a layer of real metal for the surface. It is necessary to clean them regularly. If dirty areas are left uncleaned for long periods of time, they may be difficult to clean.

list1_item.itemtxt: Remove dirt and dust using a vacuum cleaner.
Wipe off any excess dirt and dust with a soft cloth dampened with diluted detergent.
list1_item.itemtxt_sub: Use a diluted water solution of approximately 5% neutral wool detergent.

list1_item.itemtxt: Wring out any excess water from the cloth and thoroughly wipe off all remaining traces of detergent.
Wipe the surface with a dry, soft cloth to remove any remaining moisture. Allow the leather to dry in a shaded and ventilated area.

note_para.title: Caring for leather areas
note_para.p: Toyota recommends cleaning the interior of the vehicle at least twice a year to maintain the quality of the vehicle’s interior.

list1_item.itemtxt: Remove dirt and dust using a vacuum cleaner.
Wipe it off with a soft cloth dampened with neutral detergent diluted to approximately 1%.
Wring out any excess water from the cloth and thoroughly wipe off remaining traces of detergent and water.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: To ensure safe and economical driving, day-to-day care and regular maintenance are essential. Toyota recommends the maintenance below.

attention_para.title: If your vehicle is not properly maintained
attention_para.p: Improper maintenance could result in serious damage to the vehicle and possible death or serious injury.

attention_para.title: Handling of the battery
attention_para.p: Battery posts, terminals and related accessories contain lead and lead compounds which are known to cause brain damage. Wash your hands after handling. (→)

list1_item.itemtxt: Scheduled maintenance should be performed at specified intervals according to the maintenance schedule.
list1_item.itemtxt_sub: The interval for scheduled maintenance is determined by the odometer reading or the time interval, whichever comes first, shown in the schedule.
Maintenance beyond the last period should be performed at the same intervals.

list1_item.itemtxt: Where to go for maintenance service?
list1_item.itemtxt_sub: It makes good sense to take your vehicle to your local Toyota dealer for maintenance service as well as other inspections and repairs.

Toyota technicians are well-trained specialists receiving the latest service information through technical bulletins, service tips and in-dealership training programs. They learn to work on Toyota before they work on your vehicle, rather than while they are working on it. Doesn’t that seem like the best way?
Your Toyota dealer has invested a lot of money in special Toyota tools and service equipment. It helps them to do the job better and at less cost.
Your Toyota dealer’s service department will perform all of the scheduled maintenance on your vehicle reliably and economically.
Rubber hoses (for cooling and heater system, brake system and fuel system) should be inspected by a qualified technician according to the Toyota maintenance schedule.

Rubber hoses are particularly important maintenance items. Have any deteriorated or damaged hoses replaced immediately. Note that rubber hoses will deteriorate with age, resulting in swelling, chafing or cracking.

om_body.p: What about do-it-yourself maintenance?
om_body.p_sub: Many of the maintenance items are easy to do yourself if you have a little mechanical ability and a few basic automotive tools. Simple instructions for how to perform them are presented in this section.

Note, however, that some maintenance tasks require special tools and skills. These are best performed by qualified technicians. Even if you are an experienced do-it-yourself mechanic, we recommend that repairs and maintenance be conducted by your Toyota dealer who will keep a record of maintenance on your vehicle. This record could be helpful should you ever require Warranty Service.

note_para.title: Does your vehicle need repairs?
note_para.p: Be on the alert for changes in performance and sounds, and visual tip-offs that indicate service is needed. Some important clues are:

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Engine missing, stumbling or pinging
Appreciable loss of power
Strange engine noises
A fluid leak under the vehicle (However, water dripping from the air conditioning system after use is normal.)
Change in exhaust sound (This may indicate a dangerous carbon monoxide leak. Drive with the windows open and have the exhaust system checked immediately.)
Flat-looking tires, excessive tire squeal when cornering, uneven tire wear
Vehicle pulls to one side when driven straight on a level road
Strange noises related to suspension movement
Loss of brake effectiveness, spongy feeling brake pedal or clutch pedal (vehicles with a manual transmission), pedal almost touches the floor, vehicle pulls to one side when braking
Engine coolant temperature continually higher than normal (→, , )

note_para.p: If you notice any of these clues, take your vehicle to your Toyota dealer as soon as possible. Your vehicle may need adjustment or repair.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: Perform maintenance by the schedule as follows:

entry.p: Your vehicle needs to be serviced according to the normal maintenance schedule. (See “Maintenance schedule”.)

om_body.p: If you mainly operate your vehicle under one or more of the special operating conditions below, some of the maintenance schedule items need to be serviced more frequently in order to keep your vehicle in good condition. (See “Additional maintenance schedule”.)

entry.p: 1. Operating on rough or muddy roads, or roads with melted snow.
2. Operating on dusty roads. (Roads in areas where their pavement rate is low, or a cloud of dust often arises and the air is dry.)
1. Heavily loaded vehicle. (For example, using a car top carrier and so forth.)
2. Repeated short trips less than 8 km (5 miles) and outside temperatures remain below freezing. (Engine temperature will not reach to normal temperature.)
3. Repeated short trips less than 15 km (9 miles). (Engine temperature will not reach to normal temperature.)
4. Extensive idling and/or low speed driving for a long distance such as police, professional/ private use like taxi or door-to-door delivery use.
5. Continuous high speed driving (80% or more of maximum vehicle speed) for over 2 hours.

om_body.p: Maintenance operations:
I = Inspect, correct or replace as necessary
R = Replace, change or lubricate

entry.p: (Odometer reading or months, whichever comes first.)
1ZR-FE and 2ZR-FE engine for the Philippines and Malaysia
Add injector cleaner to the fuel tank every 10000 km (6000 miles).
Add injector cleaner to the fuel tank every 100000 km (60000 miles).
Fuel tank cap, fuel lines, connections and fuel vapor control valve <<See note 1.>>
Brake pedal and parking brake <<See note 4.>>
Vacuum pump for brake booster (for 1ZR-FAE engine)
Steering wheel, linkage and steering gear box
Suspension ball joints and dust covers
Shift lever for manual transmission (6-speed models)
Continuously variable transmission fluid (including front differential)

om_body.p: NOTE:
1. After 80000 km (48000 miles) or 48 months inspection, inspect every 20000 km (12000 miles) or 12 months.
2. First replace at 160000 km (100000 miles), then replace every 80000 km (50000 miles).
3. Including the filter in fuel tank.
4. Vehicles with an electric parking brake: A parking brake inspection is not necessary.
5. For Trinidad and Tobago, Barbados, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nepal, and 1ZR-FE, 1ZR-FAE and 1ZR-FBE engines for Brunei.
6. For Myanmar, Cambodia, Laos, Thailand, Indonesia, the Philippines, Malaysia, and 2ZR-FE and 2ZR-FBE engines for Brunei.
7. For Singapore only.
Refer to the following table for normal maintenance schedule items requiring more frequent service specific to the type of severe conditions. (For outline, see “Maintenance schedule requirements”.)

entry.p: A-1: Operating on rough or muddy roads, or roads with melted snow.

tbl_list1_item.itemtxt: Inspection* of brake pads and discs
Inspection* of brake pipes and hoses
Inspection* of suspension ball joints and dust covers
Inspection* of drive shaft boots
Inspection* of steering wheel, linkage and steering gear box
Inspection* of front and rear suspension
Tightening of bolts and nuts on chassis and body <<See note 1.>>

entry.p: A-2: Operating on dusty roads. (Roads in areas where their pavement rate is low, or a cloud of dust often arises and the air is dry.)

tbl_list1_item.itemtxt: Replacement of engine oil
Replacement of engine oil filter
Inspection* or replacement of air cleaner filter

entry.p: I: Every 2500 km (1500 miles) or 3 months
R: Every 40000 km (24000 miles) or 48 months

tbl_list1_item.itemtxt: Inspection* of brake pads and discs
Replacement of air conditioning filter (pollen removal type) <<See note 2.>>

entry.p: B-1: Heavily loaded vehicle. (For example, using a car top carrier and so forth.)

tbl_list1_item.itemtxt: Replacement of engine oil
Replacement of engine oil filter
Inspection* of brake pads and discs
Replacement of manual transmission fluid (including front differential)
Inspection* or replacement of continuously variable transmission fluid (including front differential)

entry.p: I: Every 40000 km (24000 miles) or 24 months
R: Every 80000 km (48000 miles) or 48 months

tbl_list1_item.itemtxt: Inspection* of front and rear suspension
Tightening of bolts and nuts on chassis and body <<See note 1.>>

entry.p: B-2: Repeated short trips less than 8 km (5 miles) and outside temperatures remain below freezing. (Engine temperature will not reach to normal temperature.)

tbl_list1_item.itemtxt: Replacement of engine oil (1ZR-FE, 1ZR-FAE and 2ZR-FE engine)
Replacement of engine oil filter (1ZR-FE, 1ZR-FAE and 2ZR-FE engine)

entry.p: B-3: Repeated short trips less than 15 km (9 miles). (Engine temperature will not reach to normal temperature.)

tbl_list1_item.itemtxt: Replacement of engine oil (1ZR-FBE and 2ZR-FBE)
Replacement of engine oil filter (1ZR-FBE and 2ZR-FBE)

entry.p: B-4: Extensive idling and/or low speed driving for a long distance such as police, professional/private use like taxi or door-to-door delivery use.

tbl_list1_item.itemtxt: Replacement of engine oil
Replacement of engine oil filter
Inspection* of brake pads and discs
Inspection* or replacement of continuously variable transmission fluid (including front differential)

entry.p: I: Every 40000 km (24000 miles) or 24 months
R: Every 80000 km (48000 miles) or 48 months
B-5: Continuous high speed driving (80% or more of maximum vehicle speed) for over 2 hours.

tbl_list1_item.itemtxt: Replacement of manual transmission fluid (including front differential)
Inspection* or replacement of continuously variable transmission fluid (including front differential)

entry.p: I: Every 40000 km (24000 miles) or 24 months
R: Every 80000 km (48000 miles) or 48 months

om_body.p: NOTE:
1. For seat mounting bolts, front and rear suspension member retaining bolts.
2. For Trinidad and Tobago, Barbados, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nepal, and 1ZR-FE, 1ZR-FAE and 1ZR-FBE engines for Brunei.

footnote.p: Perform correction or replacement as necessary.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: If you perform maintenance by yourself, be sure to follow the correct procedure as given in these sections.

tbl_list1_item.itemtxt: Warm water
Baking soda
Grease
Conventional wrench (for terminal clamp bolts)

“Toyota Super Long Life Coolant” or a similar high quality ethylene glycol-based non-silicate, non-amine, non-nitrite and non-borate coolant with long-life hybrid organic acid technology“Toyota Super Long Life Coolant” is pre-mixed with 50% coolant and 50% deionized water.
Funnel (used only for adding coolant)
“Toyota Genuine Motor Oil” or equivalent
Rag or paper towel
Funnel (used only for adding engine oil)
Fuse with same amperage rating as original
Bulb with same number and wattage rating as original
Flathead screwdriver
Wrench
Tire pressure gauge
Compressed air source
Water or washer fluid containing antifreeze (for winter use)
Funnel (used only for adding water or washer fluid)

attention_para.p: The engine compartment contains many mechanisms and fluids that may move suddenly, become hot, or become electrically energized. To avoid death or serious injury, observe the following precautions.

attention_para.title: When working on the engine compartment

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Keep hands, clothing and tools away from the moving fan and engine drive belt.
Be careful not to touch the engine, radiator, exhaust manifold, etc. right after driving as they may be hot. Oil and other fluids may also be hot.
Do not leave anything that may burn easily, such as paper and rags, in the engine compartment.
Do not smoke, cause sparks or expose an open flame to fuel or the battery. Fuel and battery fumes are flammable.
Be extremely cautious when working on the battery. It contains poisonous and corrosive sulfuric acid.

Take care because brake fluid can harm your hands or eyes and damage painted surfaces. If fluid gets on your hands or in your eyes, flush the affected area with clean water immediately.If you still experience discomfort, consult a doctor.

attention_para.title: When working near the electric cooling fan or radiator grille
attention_para.p: Be sure the engine switch is OFF.With the engine switch in ON, the electric cooling fan may automatically start to run if the air conditioning is on and/or the coolant temperature is high. (→)

attention_para.title: Safety glasses
attention_para.p: Wear safety glasses to prevent flying or falling material, fluid spray, etc. from getting in your eyes.

attention_para.title: If you remove the air cleaner filter
attention_para.p: Driving with the air cleaner filter removed may cause excessive engine wear due to dirt in the air.

attention_para.title: If the fluid level is low or high
attention_para.p: It is normal for the brake fluid level to go down slightly as the brake pads wear or when the fluid level in the accumulator is high.If the reservoir needs frequent refilling, it may indicate a serious problem.

stepitem.steptxt: Pull the hood lock release lever.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: The hood will pop up slightly.

stepitem.steptxt: Pull the auxiliary catch lever to the left and lift the hood.
Hold the hood open by inserting the support rod into the slot.

attention_para.title: Pre-driving check
attention_para.p: Check that the hood is fully closed and locked.If the hood is not locked properly, it may open while the vehicle is in motion and cause an accident, which may result in death or serious injury.

attention_para.title: After installing the support rod into the slot
attention_para.p: Make sure the rod supports the hood securely preventing it from falling down onto your head or body.

attention_para.title: When closing the hood
attention_para.p: Be sure to return the support rod to its clip before closing the hood. Closing the hood with the support rod not clipped could cause the hood to bend.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: When using a floor jack, follow the instructions in the manual provided with the jack and perform the operation safely.When raising your vehicle with a floor jack, position the jack correctly. Improper placement may damage your vehicle or cause injury.

titlegroupcell.title: Checking and adding the engine oil

om_body.p: With the engine at operating temperature and turned off, check the oil level on the dipstick.

stepitem.steptxt: Park the vehicle on level ground. After warming up the engine and turning it off, wait more than 5 minutes for the oil to drain back into the bottom of the engine.
Holding a rag under the end, pull the dipstick out.

list1_item.itemtxt: 1ZR-FE, 1ZR-FAE, 1ZR-FBE, 2ZR-FE and 2ZR-FBE engines
M20A-FKS engine

stepitem.steptxt: Wipe the dipstick clean.
Reinsert the dipstick fully.
Holding a rag under the end, pull the dipstick out and check the oil level.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: The shape of the dipstick may differ depending on the type of vehicle or engine.

stepitem.steptxt: Wipe the dipstick and reinsert it fully.

om_body.title: Checking the oil type and preparing the item needed
om_body.p: Make sure to check the oil type and prepare the items needed before adding oil.

list1_item.itemtxt: Engine oil selection→, ,
Oil quantity (Low → Full)1.5 L (1.6 qt., 1.3 Imp. qt.)
ItemClean funnel

om_body.title: Adding engine oil
om_body.p: If the oil level is below or near the low level mark, add engine oil of the same type as that already in the engine.

list1_item.itemtxt: 1ZR-FE, 1ZR-FAE, 1ZR-FBE, 2ZR-FE and 2ZR-FBE engines
M20A-FKS engine

stepitem.steptxt: Remove the oil filler cap by turning it counterclockwise.
Add engine oil slowly, checking the dipstick.
Install the oil filler cap by turning it clockwise.

note_para.title: Engine oil consumption
note_para.p: A certain amount of engine oil will be consumed while driving. In the following situations, oil consumption may increase, and engine oil may need to be refilled in between oil maintenance intervals.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: When the engine is new, for example directly after purchasing the vehicle or after replacing the engine
If low quality oil or oil of an inappropriate viscosity is used
When driving at high engine speeds or with a heavy load, or when driving while accelerating or decelerating frequently
When leaving the engine idling for a long time, or when driving frequently through heavy traffic

Used engine oil contains potentially harmful contaminants which may cause skin disorders such as inflammation and skin cancer, so care should be taken to avoid prolonged and repeated contact. To remove used engine oil from your skin, wash thoroughly with soap and water.

Dispose of used oil and filters only in a safe and acceptable manner. Do not dispose of used oil and filters in household trash, in sewers or onto the ground.Call your Toyota dealer, service station or auto parts store for information concerning recycling or disposal.
Do not leave used engine oil within the reach of children.

attention_para.title: To prevent serious engine damage
attention_para.p: Check the oil level on a regular basis.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Be careful not to spill engine oil on the vehicle components.
Avoid overfilling, or the engine could be damaged.
Check the oil level on the dipstick every time you refill the vehicle.
Be sure the engine oil filler cap is properly tightened.

om_body.p: The coolant level is satisfactory if it is between the “FULL” and “LOW” lines on the reservoir when the engine is cold.

calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: If the level is on or below the “LOW” line, add coolant up to the “FULL” line. (→)

note_para.title: Coolant selection
note_para.p: Only use “Toyota Super Long Life Coolant” or a similar high quality ethylene glycol based non-silicate, non-amine, non-nitrite, and non-borate coolant with long-life hybrid organic acid technology.
“Toyota Super Long Life Coolant” is a mixture of 50% coolant and 50% deionized water. (Minimum temperature: -35°C [-31°F])
For more details about coolant, contact your Toyota dealer.

note_para.title: If the coolant level drops within a short time of replenishing
note_para.p: Visually check the radiator, hoses, engine coolant reservoir caps, drain cock and water pump.If you cannot find a leak, have your Toyota dealer test the cap and check for leaks in the cooling system.

attention_para.title: When the engine is hot
attention_para.p: Do not remove the engine coolant reservoir cap.
The cooling system may be under pressure and may spray hot coolant if the cap is removed, causing serious injuries, such as burns.

attention_para.title: When adding coolant
attention_para.p: Coolant is neither plain water nor straight antifreeze. The correct mixture of water and antifreeze must be used to provide proper lubrication, corrosion protection and cooling. Be sure to read the antifreeze or coolant label.

attention_para.title: If you spill coolant
attention_para.p: Be sure to wash it off with water to prevent it from damaging parts or paint.

om_body.p: Check the radiator and condenser and clear away any foreign objects. If either of the above parts is extremely dirty or you are not sure of their condition, have your vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer.

attention_para.title: When the engine is hot
attention_para.p: Do not touch the radiator or condenser as they may be hot and cause serious injuries, such as burns.

om_body.p: Check the battery as follows.

om_body.title: Caution symbols
om_body.p: The meanings of each caution symbol on the top of the battery are as follows:

entry.p: No smoking, no naked flames, no sparks

om_body.title: Battery exterior
om_body.p: Make sure that the battery terminals are not corroded and that there are no loose connections, cracks, or loose clamps.

note_para.title: Before recharging
note_para.p: When recharging, the battery produces hydrogen gas which is flammable and explosive. Therefore, observe the following precautions before recharging:

att_list1_item.itemtxt: If recharging with the battery installed on the vehicle, be sure to disconnect the ground cable.
Make sure the engine switch on the charger is off when connecting and disconnecting the charger cables to the battery.

note_para.title: After recharging/reconnecting the battery (vehicles with a smart entry & start system)

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Unlocking the doors using the smart entry & start system may not be possible immediately after reconnecting the battery. If this happens, use the wireless remote control or the mechanical key to lock/unlock the doors.
Start the engine with the engine switch in ACC. The engine may not start with the engine switch turned off. However, the engine will operate normally from the second attempt.

The engine switch mode is recorded by the vehicle. If the battery is reconnected, the vehicle will return the engine switch mode to the status it was in before the battery was disconnected. Make sure to turn off the engine before disconnecting the battery. Take extra care when connecting the battery if the engine switch mode prior to discharge is unknown.

note_para.p: If the system will not start even after multiple attempts, contact your Toyota dealer.

note_para.title: When replacing the battery (vehicle with a battery insulator)
note_para.p: Replace with a battery the same size as the originally equipped battery so that the battery insulator can be installed on the new battery.

attention_para.title: Chemicals in the battery
attention_para.p: The battery contains poisonous and corrosive sulfuric acid and may produce hydrogen gas which is flammable and explosive. To reduce the risk of death or serious injury, take the following precautions while working on or near the battery:

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Do not cause sparks by touching the battery terminals with tools.
Do not smoke or light a match near the battery.
Avoid contact with eyes, skin and clothes.
Never inhale or swallow electrolyte.
Wear protective safety glasses when working near the battery.
Keep children away from the battery.

attention_para.title: Where to safely charge the battery
attention_para.p: Always charge the battery in an open area. Do not charge the battery in a garage or closed room where there is insufficient ventilation.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: If electrolyte gets in your eyesFlush your eyes with clean water for at least 15 minutes and get immediate medical attention. If possible, continue to apply water with a sponge or cloth while traveling to the nearest medical facility.
If electrolyte gets on your skinWash the affected area thoroughly. If you feel pain or burning, get medical attention immediately.
If electrolyte gets on your clothesIt can soak through clothing on to your skin. Immediately take off the clothing and follow the procedure above if necessary.
If you accidentally swallow electrolyteDrink a large quantity of water or milk. Get emergency medical attention immediately.

attention_para.title: When disconnecting the battery
attention_para.p: Do not disconnect the negative (-) terminal on the body side. The disconnected negative (-) terminal may touch the positive (+) terminal, which may cause a short and result in death or serious injury.

attention_para.title: When recharging the battery
attention_para.p: Never recharge the battery while the engine is running. Also, be sure all accessories are turned off.

om_body.p: If any washer does not work, the washer tank may be empty. Add washer fluid.

attention_para.title: When adding washer fluid
attention_para.p: Do not add washer fluid when the engine is hot or running as washer fluid contains alcohol and may catch fire if spilled on the engine, etc.

attention_para.title: Do not use any fluid other than washer fluid
attention_para.p: Do not use soapy water or engine antifreeze instead of washer fluid.Doing so may cause streaking on the vehicle’s painted surfaces, as well as damaging the pump leading to problems of the washer fluid not spraying.

attention_para.title: Diluting washer fluid
attention_para.p: Dilute washer fluid with water as necessary.Refer to the freezing temperatures listed on the label of the washer fluid bottle.

titlegroupcell.title: Checking the air cleaner filter (1ZR-FE and M20A-FKS engines)

om_body.p: Check the air cleaner filter as follows:

stepitem.steptxt: Release the clips.
Lift the cover and take out the air cleaner filter.
After checking, make sure the filter is set properly. Fully engage the claws and then secure the upper cover of the air cleaner case using the clips.

om_body.p: Inspect the outer surface of the filter, and replace the filter if it is extremely dirty. If the filter is only moderately dusty, use compressed air to blow dust out of the filter.

attention_para.title: To prevent inhaling dust
attention_para.p: Wear a respirator when using compressed air to clean the air cleaner filter.

attention_para.title: To prevent damaging the engine
attention_para.p: Do not drive with the air cleaner filter removed. Doing so causes excessive engine wear.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: Replace or rotate tires in accordance with maintenance schedules and treadwear.

om_body.p: Check if the treadwear indicators are showing on the tires. Also check the tires for uneven wear, such as excessive wear on one side of the tread.
Check the spare tire condition and pressure if not rotated.

calloutitem.callouttxt_sub: The location of treadwear indicators is shown by a “TWI” or “” mark, etc., molded into the sidewall of each tire.Replace the tires if the treadwear indicators are showing on a tire.

note_para.title: When to replace your vehicle’s tires
note_para.p: Tires should be replaced if:

att_list1_item.itemtxt: The treadwear indicators are showing on a tire.
You have tire damage such as cuts, splits, cracks deep enough to expose the fabric, and bulges indicating internal damage
A tire goes flat repeatedly or cannot be properly repaired due to the size or location of a cut or other damage

note_para.p: If you are not sure, consult with your Toyota dealer.

note_para.title: Tire life
note_para.p: Any tire over 6 years old must be checked by a qualified technician even if it has seldom or never been used or damage is not obvious.

note_para.title: Low profile tires (17-inch tires)
note_para.p: Generally, low profile tires will wear more rapidly and tire grip performance will be reduced on snowy and/or icy roads when compared to standard tires. Be sure to use snow tires or tire chains on snowy and/or icy roads and drive carefully at a speed appropriate for road and weather conditions.

note_para.title: If the tread on snow tires wears down below 4 mm (0.16 in.)
note_para.p: The effectiveness of the tires as snow tires is lost.

note_para.title: Checking the tire valves
note_para.p: When replacing the tires, check the tire valves for deformation, cracks, and other damage.

attention_para.title: When inspecting or replacing tires
attention_para.p: Observe the following precautions to prevent accidents.Failure to do so may cause damage to parts of the drive train as well as dangerous handling characteristics, which may lead to an accident resulting in death or serious injury.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Do not mix tires of different makes, models or tread patterns.Also, do not mix tires of remarkably different treadwear.
Do not use tire sizes other than those recommended by Toyota.
Do not mix differently constructed tires (radial, bias-belted or bias-ply tires).
Do not mix summer, all season and snow tires.
Do not use tires that have been used on another vehicle.Do not use tires if you do not know how they were used previously.

attention_para.title: Low profile tires (17-inch tires)
attention_para.p: Low profile tires may cause greater damage than usual to the tire wheel when sustaining impact from the road surface. Therefore, pay attention to the following:

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Be sure to use proper tire inflation pressure. If tires are under-inflated, they may be damaged more severely.
Avoid potholes, uneven pavement, curbs and other road hazards. Failure to do so may lead to severe tire and wheel damage.

attention_para.title: If tire inflation pressure of each tire becomes low while driving
attention_para.p: Do not continue driving, or your tires and/or wheels may be ruined.

attention_para.title: Driving on rough roads
attention_para.p: Take particular care when driving on roads with loose surfaces or potholes.These conditions may cause losses in tire inflation pressure, reducing the cushioning ability of the tires. In addition, driving on rough roads may cause damage to the tires themselves, as well as the vehicle’s wheels and body.

om_body.p: Rotate the tires in the order shown.

list1_item.itemtxt: Vehicles without a full-size spare tire.
Vehicles with a full-size spare tire

om_body.p_sub: To equalize tire wear and help extend tire life, Toyota recommends that tire rotation is carried out approximately every 10000 km (6000 miles).

Vehicles with a tire pressure warning system: When rotating front and rear tires which have different tire inflation pressures, do not fail to initialize the tire pressure warning system after tire rotation.

om_body.p: Your vehicle is equipped with a tire pressure warning system that uses tire pressure warning valves and transmitters to detect low tire inflation pressure before serious problems arise.
If the tire pressure drops below a predetermined level, the driver is warned by a warning light. (→)

note_para.title: Routine tire inflation pressure checks
note_para.p: The tire pressure warning system does not replace routine tire inflation pressure checks. Make sure to check tire inflation pressure as part of your routine of daily vehicle checks.

note_para.title: Situations in which the tire pressure warning system may not operate properly

att_list1_item.itemtxt: In the following cases, the tire pressure warning system may not operate properly.

att_list2_item.itemtxt: If non-genuine Toyota wheels are used.
A tire has been replaced with a tire that is not an OE (Original Equipment) tire.
A tire has been replaced with a tire that is not of the specified size.
Tire chains, etc. are equipped.
An auxiliary-supported run-flat tire is equipped.
If a window tint that affects the radio wave signals is installed.
If there is a lot of snow or ice on the vehicle, particularly around the wheels or wheel housings.
If the tire inflation pressure is extremely higher than the specified level.
If tires not equipped with tire pressure warning valves and transmitters are used.
If the ID code on the tire pressure warning valves and transmitters is not registered in the tire pressure warning computer.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Performance may be affected in the following situations.

att_list2_item.itemtxt: Near a TV tower, electric power plant, gas station, radio station, large display, airport or other facility that generates strong radio waves or electrical noise.
When carrying a portable radio, cellular phone, cordless phone or other wireless communication device.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: When the vehicle is parked, the time taken for the warning to start or go off could be extended.
When tire inflation pressure declines rapidly for example when a tire has burst, the warning may not function.

note_para.title: Warning performance of the tire pressure warning system
note_para.p: The warning of the tire pressure warning system will change in accordance with driving conditions. For this reason, the system may give a warning even if the tire pressure does not reach a low enough level, or if the pressure is higher than the pressure that was adjusted to when the system was initialized.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: For Indonesia
For Taiwan
For Vietnam
For United Arab Emirates

titlegroupcell.title: Installing tire pressure warning valves and transmitters (vehicles with a tire pressure warning system)

om_body.p: When replacing tires or wheels, tire pressure warning valves and transmitters must also be installed.

When new tire pressure warning valves and transmitters are installed, new ID codes must be registered in the tire pressure warning computer and the tire pressure warning system must be initialized. Have tire pressure warning valves and transmitter ID codes registered by your Toyota dealer. (→)

note_para.title: Replacing tires and wheels
note_para.p: If the ID code of the tire pressure warning valve and transmitter is not registered, the tire pressure warning system will not work properly. After driving for about 10 minutes, the tire pressure warning light blinks for 1 minute and stays on to indicate a system malfunction.

attention_para.title: Repairing or replacing tires, wheels, tire pressure warning valves, transmitters and tire valve caps

att_list1_item.itemtxt: When removing or fitting the wheels, tires or the tire pressure warning valves and transmitters, contact your Toyota dealer as the tire pressure warning valves and transmitters may be damaged if not handled correctly.
Make sure to install the tire valve caps. If the tire valve caps are not installed, water could enter the tire pressure warning valves and the tire pressure warning valves could be bound.
When replacing tire valve caps, do not use tire valve caps other than those specified. The cap may become stuck.

attention_para.title: To avoid damage to the tire pressure warning valves and transmitters
attention_para.p: When a tire is repaired with liquid sealants, the tire pressure warning valve and transmitter may not operate properly. If a liquid sealant is used, contact your Toyota dealer or other qualified service shop as soon as possible. Make sure to replace the tire pressure warning valve and transmitter when replacing the tire. (→)

titlegroupcell.title: Initializing the tire pressure warning system (if equipped)

om_body.title: The tire pressure warning system must be initialized in the following circumstances:

list1_item.itemtxt: When rotating front and rear tires which have different tire inflation pressures.
When changing the tire size.

om_body.p: When the tire pressure warning system is initialized, the current tire inflation pressure is set as the benchmark pressure.

om_body.title: How to initialize the tire pressure warning system

stepitem.steptxt: Park the vehicle in a safe place and turn the engine switch off.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: Initialization cannot be performed while the vehicle is moving.

stepitem.steptxt: Adjust the tire inflation pressure to the specified cold tire inflation pressure level. (→)
stepitem.steptxt_sub: Make sure to adjust the tire pressure to the specified cold tire inflation pressure level. The tire pressure warning system will operate based on this pressure level.

stepitem.steptxt: Turn the engine switch to ON.
Press and hold the tire pressure warning reset switch until the tire pressure warning light blinks slowly 3 times.
Wait for a few minutes with the engine switch in ON and then turn the engine switch off.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Make sure to carry out initialization after adjusting the tire inflation pressure.Also, make sure the tires are cold before carrying out initialization or tire inflation pressure adjustment.

If you have accidentally turned the engine switch off during initialization, it is not necessary to press the reset switch again as initialization will restart automatically when the engine switch is turned to ON the next time.
If you accidentally press the reset switch when initialization is not necessary, adjust the tire inflation pressure to the specified level when the tires are cold, and conduct initialization again.

note_para.title: When initialization of the tire pressure warning system has failed
note_para.p: Initialization can be completed in a few minutes. However, in the following cases, the settings have not been recorded and the system will not operate properly. If repeated attempts to record tire inflation pressure settings are unsuccessful, have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: When operating the tire pressure warning reset switch, the tire pressure warning light does not blink 3 times.
After driving for a certain period of time since the initialization has been completed, the warning light comes on after blinking for 1 minute.

attention_para.title: When initializing the tire pressure warning system
attention_para.p: Do not operate the tire pressure warning reset switch without first adjusting the tire inflation pressure to the specified level. Otherwise, the tire pressure warning light may not come on even if the tire inflation pressure is low, or it may come on when the tire inflation pressure is actually normal.

om_body.p: The tire pressure warning valve and transmitter is equipped with a unique ID code. When replacing a tire pressure warning valve and transmitter, it is necessary to register the ID code. Have the ID code registered by your Toyota dealer.

note_para.title: Registering ID codes
note_para.p: The ID codes of the tire pressure warning valve and transmitters for two sets of wheels can be registered.
It is not necessary to register the ID codes when replacing normal tires with snow tires, if the ID codes for the wheels of both normal tires and snow tires are registered beforehand.
For information about changing ID codes, ask your Toyota dealer.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: Make sure to maintain proper tire inflation pressure. Tire inflation pressure should be checked at least once per month. However, Toyota recommends that tire inflation pressure be checked once every two weeks. (→)

om_body.p: Tire inflation pressure is specified on the label on the driver’s side pillar as shown.

list1_item.itemtxt: Left-hand drive vehicles
Right-hand drive vehicles

note_para.title: Effects of incorrect tire inflation pressure
note_para.p: Driving with incorrect tire inflation pressure may result in the following:

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Reduced fuel economy
Reduced driving comfort and poor handling
Reduced tire life due to wear
Reduced safety
Damage to the drive train

note_para.p: If a tire needs frequent inflating, have it checked by your Toyota dealer.

note_para.title: Instructions for checking tire inflation pressure
note_para.p: When checking tire inflation pressure, observe the following:

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Check only when the tires are cold.If your vehicle has been parked for at least 3 hours or has not been driven for more than 1.5 km or 1 mile, you will get an accurate cold tire inflation pressure reading.
Always use a tire pressure gauge.It is difficult to judge if a tire is properly inflated based only on its appearance.
It is normal for the tire inflation pressure to be higher after driving as heat is generated in the tire. Do not reduce tire inflation pressure after driving.
Passengers and luggage weight should be placed so that the vehicle is balanced.

attention_para.title: Proper inflation is critical to save tire performance
attention_para.p: Keep your tires properly inflated.If the tires are not properly inflated, the following conditions may occur which could lead to an accident resulting in death or serious injury:

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Excessive wear
Uneven wear
Poor handling
Possibility of blowouts resulting from overheated tires
Air leaking from between tire and wheel
Wheel deformation and/or tire damage
Greater possibility of tire damage while driving (due to road hazards, expansion joints, sharp edges in the road, etc.)

attention_para.title: When inspecting and adjusting tire inflation pressure
attention_para.p: Be sure to put the tire valve caps back on.If a valve cap is not installed, dirt or moisture may get into the valve and cause an air leak, resulting in decreased tire inflation pressure.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: If a wheel is bent, cracked or heavily corroded, it should be replaced. Otherwise, the tire may separate from the wheel or cause a loss of handling control.

om_body.p: When replacing wheels, care should be taken to ensure that they are equivalent to those removed in load capacity, diameter, rim width and inset*.
Replacement wheels are available at your Toyota dealer.
Toyota does not recommend using the following:

list1_item.itemtxt: Wheels of different sizes or types
Used wheels
Bent wheels that have been straightened

note_para.title: When replacing wheels (vehicles with a tire pressure warning system)
note_para.p: The wheels of your vehicle are equipped with tire pressure warning valves and transmitters that allow the tire pressure warning system to provide advance warning in the event of a loss in tire inflation pressure. Whenever wheels are replaced, the tire pressure warning valves and transmitters must be installed. (→)

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Do not use wheels that are a different size from those recommended in the Owner’s Manual, as this may result in a loss of handling control.
Never use an inner tube in a leaking wheel which is designed for a tubeless tire.Doing so may result in an accident, causing death or serious injury.

Be sure to install the wheel nuts with the tapered ends facing inward. Installing the nuts with the tapered ends facing outward can cause the wheel to break and eventually cause the wheel to come off while driving, which could lead to an accident resulting in death or serious injury.

Never use oil or grease on the wheel bolts or wheel nuts.Oil and grease may cause the wheel nuts to be excessively tightened, leading to bolt or disc wheel damage. In addition, the oil or grease can cause the wheel nuts to loosen and the wheel may fall off, causing an accident and resulting in death or serious injury. Remove any oil or grease from the wheel bolts or wheel nuts.

attention_para.title: Use of defective wheels prohibited
attention_para.p: Do not use cracked or deformed wheels. Doing so could cause the tire to leak air during driving, possibly causing an accident.

attention_para.title: Replacing tire pressure warning valves and transmitters (vehicles with a tire pressure warning system)

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Because tire repair or replacement may affect the tire pressure warning valves and transmitters, make sure to have tires serviced by your Toyota dealer or other qualified service shop. In addition, make sure to purchase your tire pressure warning valves and transmitters at your Toyota dealer.
Ensure that only genuine Toyota wheels are used on your vehicle.Tire pressure warning valves and transmitters may not work properly with non-genuine wheels.

list1_item.itemtxt: Use only Toyota wheel nuts and wheel nut wrenches designed for use with your aluminum wheels.
When rotating, repairing or changing your tires, check that the wheel nuts are still tight after driving 1600 km (1000 miles).
Be careful not to damage the aluminum wheels when using tire chains.
Use only Toyota genuine balance weights or equivalent and a plastic or rubber hammer when balancing your wheels.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: The air conditioning filter must be changed regularly to maintain air conditioning efficiency.

stepitem.steptxt: Turn the engine switch off.
Open the glove box. Slide off the damper (if equipped).
Push in the glove box on the vehicle’s outer side to disconnect the claws. Then pull out the glove box and disconnect the lower claws.
Unlock the filter cover (), pull the filter cover out of the claws (), and remove the filter cover.
Remove the air conditioning filter and replace it with a new one.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: The “UP” marks shown on the filter should be pointing up.

note_para.title: Checking interval
note_para.p: Replace the air conditioning filter according to the maintenance schedule.(→) In dusty areas or areas with heavy traffic flow, early replacement may be required.

note_para.title: If air flow from the vents decreases dramatically
note_para.p: The filter may be clogged. Check the filter and replace if necessary.

note_para.title: Air conditioning filter with deodorizing function (if equipped)
note_para.p: When fragrances are placed in your vehicle, the deodorizing effect may become significantly weakened in a short period.When an air conditioning odor comes out continuously, replace the air conditioning filter.

attention_para.title: When using the air conditioning system
attention_para.p: Make sure that a filter is always installed.Using the air conditioning system without a filter may cause damage to the system.

attention_para.title: To prevent damage to the filter cover
attention_para.p: When moving the filter cover in the direction of arrow to release the fitting, pay attention not to apply excessive force to the claws. Otherwise, the claws may be damaged.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: Replace the battery with a new one if it is depleted.As the key may be damaged if the following procedure is not performed properly, it is recommended that key battery replacement be performed by your Toyota dealer.

note_para.title: If the key battery is depleted
note_para.p: The following symptoms may occur:

att_list1_item.itemtxt: The smart entry & start system (if equipped) and wireless remote control will not function properly.
The operational range will be reduced.

list1_item.itemtxt: Flathead screwdriver
Small flathead screwdriver
Lithium battery CR2032

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Batteries can be purchased at your Toyota dealer, local electrical appliance shops or camera stores.
Replace only with the same or equivalent type recommended by the manufacturer.
Dispose of used batteries according to local laws.

paraselectitem.title: Vehicles without a smart entry & start system

stepitem.steptxt: Remove the key cover.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: To prevent damage to the key, cover the tip of the flathead screwdriver with a rag.

stepitem.steptxt: Remove the battery cover.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: If the battery cover is difficult to remove, lift the edge to remove it.

stepitem.steptxt: Remove the depleted battery using a small flathead screwdriver.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: Insert a new battery with the “+” terminal facing up.

stepitem.steptxt: Install the battery cover with the tab facing up.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: Push the entire edge of the battery cover into the key.

stepitem.steptxt: Install the key cover.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: Align the key cover with the key and then press it straight into the key.
Make sure that the key cover is securely installed without any gaps between it and the key.

stepitem.steptxt: Operate the or switch and check that the doors can be locked/unlocked.

paraselectitem.title: Vehicles with a smart entry & start system

stepitem.steptxt: Release the lock and remove the mechanical key.
Remove the key cover.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: To prevent damage to the key, cover the tip of the flathead screwdriver with a rag.

stepitem.steptxt: Remove the depleted battery using a small flathead screwdriver.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: When removing the cover, the electronic key module may stick to the cover and the battery may not be visible. In this case, remove the electronic key module in order to remove the battery.
Insert a new battery with the “+” terminal facing up.

stepitem.steptxt: When installing the key cover and mechanical key, install by conducting step 2 and step 1 with the directions reversed.
Operate the or switch and check that the doors can be locked/unlocked.

attention_para.title: Removed battery and other parts
attention_para.p: These parts are small and if swallowed by a child, they can cause choking. Keep away from children. Failure to do so could result in death or serious injury.

attention_para.title: Lithium battery precautions
attention_para.p: CAUTIONRISK OF EXPLOSION IF BATTERY IS REPLACED BY AN INCORRECT TYPE.DISPOSE OF USED BATTERIES ACCORDING TO THE INSTRUCTIONS

attention_para.title: When replacing the battery
attention_para.p: Use a flathead screwdriver of appropriate size. Applying excessive force may deform or damage the cover.

attention_para.title: For normal operation after replacing the battery
attention_para.p: Observe the following precautions to prevent accidents:

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Always work with dry hands.Moisture may cause the battery to rust.
Do not touch or move any other component inside the remote control.
Do not bend either of the battery terminals.

attention_para.title: When removing the battery cover (vehicles without a smart entry & start system)
attention_para.p: Do not forcibly remove the battery cover, otherwise it may be damaged.If the battery cover is difficult to remove, lift the edge to remove it.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: If any of the electrical components do not operate, a fuse may have blown. If this happens, check and replace the fuses as necessary.

stepitem.steptxt: Turn the engine switch off.
Open the fuse box cover.

list1_item.itemtxt: Engine compartment: type A fuse box
list1_item.itemtxt_sub: Push the tabs in and lift the lid off.

list1_item.itemtxt: Engine compartment: type B fuse box
list1_item.itemtxt_sub: Push the tabs in and lift the lid off.

list1_item.itemtxt: Under the driver’s side instrument panel (left-hand drive vehicles)
list1_item.itemtxt_sub: Make sure to push the claw when removing/installing the lid.

list1_item.itemtxt: Under the passenger’s side instrument panel (right-hand drive vehicles)
list1_item.itemtxt_sub: Remove the cover and then remove the lid.
Make sure to push the claw when removing/installing the lid.

stepitem.steptxt: Remove the fuse with the pullout tool.Only type A fuse can be removed using the pullout tool.
Check if the fuse is blown.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: Replace the blown fuse with a new fuse of an appropriate amperage rating. The amperage rating can be found on the fuse box lid.

list1_item.itemtxt: Type A
Type B
Type C
Type D
Type E

att_list1_item.itemtxt: When installing the lid, make sure that the tab is installed securely.
If the lights do not turn on even after the fuse has been replaced, a bulb may need replacement. (→)
If the replaced fuse blows again, have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer.

note_para.title: If there is an overload in a circuit
note_para.p: The fuses are designed to blow, protecting the wiring harness from damage.

note_para.title: When replacing light bulbs
note_para.p: Toyota recommends that you use genuine Toyota products designed for this vehicle.Because certain bulbs are connected to circuits designed to prevent overload, non-genuine parts of parts not designed for this vehicle may be unusable.

attention_para.title: To prevent system breakdowns and vehicle fire
attention_para.p: Observe the following precautions.Failure to do so may cause damage to the vehicle, and possibly a fire or injury.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Never use a fuse of a higher amperage rating than that indicated, or use any other object in place of a fuse.
Always use a genuine Toyota fuse or equivalent.Never replace a fuse with a wire, even as a temporary fix.
Do not modify the fuses or fuse boxes.

attention_para.title: Before replacing fuses
attention_para.p: Have the cause of electrical overload determined and repaired by your Toyota dealer as soon as possible.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: You may replace the following bulbs by yourself. The difficulty level of replacement varies depending on the bulb. As there is a danger that components may be damaged, we recommend that replacement is carried out by your Toyota dealer.

om_body.p: Check the wattage of the light bulb to be replaced. (→)

om_body.title: Bulbs that need to be replaced by your Toyota dealer

list1_item.itemtxt: Headlights (LED type)
Daytime running/front position lights (if equipped)
Front position lights (LED type)
Front turn signal lights (LED type)
Front fog lights (if equipped)
Side turn signal lights
Stop lights
Tail lights (LED type)
Back-up light
Rear fog light (if equipped)
High mounted stoplight
Rear turn signal lights (LED type)

note_para.title: LED light bulbs
note_para.p: The lights other than the headlights (bulb type), front turn signal lights (bulb type), front position lights (bulb type), tail lights (bulb type), rear turn signal lights (bulb type) and license plate lights consist of a number of LEDs. If any of the LEDs burn out, take your vehicle to your Toyota dealer to have the light replaced.

note_para.title: Condensation build-up on the inside of the lens
note_para.p: Temporary condensation build-up on the inside of the headlight lens does not indicate a malfunction. Contact your Toyota dealer for more information in the following situations:

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Large drops of water have built up on the inside of the lens.
Water has built up inside the headlight.

stepitem.steptxt: Turn the bulb base counterclockwise.
Pull the bulb out while pressing the lock release of the connector.
Replace the light bulb, and install the bulb base.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: Align the 3 tabs on the light bulb with the mounting and insert.

stepitem.steptxt: Turn and secure the bulb base.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: Shake the bulb base gently to check that it is not loose, turn the headlights on once and visually confirm that no light is leaking through the mounting.

stepitem.steptxt: Turn the bulb base counterclockwise.
Remove the light bulb.
When installing, reverse the steps listed.
Turn the bulb base counterclockwise.
Remove the light bulb.
When installing, reverse the steps listed.
Open the trunk lid.
Insert a flathead screwdriver between the cover and the light assembly and pry up the cover to disengage the claws (indicated by a dotted line).
stepitem.steptxt_sub: To prevent scratching the vehicle, wrap the tip of the flathead screwdriver with a cloth, etc.

stepitem.steptxt: Pull the cover toward the rear of the vehicle and remove the cover.
Remove the 2 screws and then remove the light assembly by pulling it straight back.
Turn the bulb base counterclockwise.
Remove the light bulb.
When installing the light bulb, install it by conducting steps 6 and 5 with the directions reversed.
Install the light assembly and then install the 2 screws.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: Align the guide and pin on the light assembly with the mounting when installing it.

stepitem.steptxt: Install the cover.
Open the trunk lid, remove the clips, and pull back the cover.
Turn the bulb base counterclockwise and remove it.
Remove the light bulb.
When installing, reverse the steps listed.
Open the trunk lid, remove the clips, and pull back the cover.
Turn the bulb base counterclockwise.
Remove the light bulb.
When installing, reverse the steps listed.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Turn off the lights. Do not attempt to replace the bulb immediately after turning off the lights. The bulbs become very hot and may cause burns.

Do not touch the glass portion of the light bulb with bare hands. When it is unavoidable to hold the glass portion, use and hold with a clean dry cloth to avoid getting moisture and oils on the bulb. Also, if the bulb is scratched or dropped, it may blow out or crack.

Fully install light bulbs and any parts used to secure them. Failure to do so may result in heat damage, fire, or water entering the light unit. This may damage the lights or cause condensation to build up on the lens.

attention_para.title: To prevent damage or fire
attention_para.p: Make sure bulbs are fully seated and locked.
